meanings.definition: In a hypercritical manner; excessively critical or fault-finding.
meanings.sent1: She always looks at her work hypercritically, never satisfied with anything she does.
meanings.sent2: He hypercritically pointed out every flaw in the painting, making the artist feel discouraged.
meanings.sent3: The movie critic watched the film hypercritically, finding faults even in the smallest details.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the room hypercritically, as if searching for imperfections no one else could see.
meanings.sent5: The teacher examined the students' essays hypercritically, leaving no error unnoticed.

meanings.sent1: His hypercritically high standards made it difficult for anyone to meet his expectations.
meanings.sent2: The hypercritically judgmental aunt always found something to criticize at family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The hypercritically strict coach demanded perfection from his players, never satisfied with their performance.
meanings.sent4: The hypercritically clean freak scrubbed the kitchen counters until they gleamed, never content with their appearance.
meanings.sent5: Her hypercritically sharp tongue could cut through even the thickest skin, leaving others feeling wounded.
